website_summaries.verdict: A rugged and comfortable jacket with several special features that help to keep out the snow and cold.
pros: Available in several colors and styles
Made with 100% polyester lining with polyurethane membrane and nylon shell
Numerous pockets, including media and goggle pockets
Helmet-compatible hood and removable  waist gaiter
cons: Some feel jacket is too thin
Runs a little large, so consider ordering size smaller

customer_reviews.title: Super warm, fits great, looks dank
customer_reviews.text: Excellent jacket. Got this without trying on a Burton jacket ever and I loved it. I'm 6'0 and a large fit just as it should (a little baggy, but still warm). Speaking of, all I wore under this was a long sleeved shirt in 10 degree weather and it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great winter jacket!
customer_reviews.text: This was a blind purchase and I did not know if this was going to keep me warm up in the high mountains of Utah. Boy, was I glad I bought this jacket! Not only is it long down your waist (which is perfect since I am tall) It is warm and windproof. I even had to take it off at one point because I was too warm. This is a comfortable jacket and has a bunch of conveniences to it. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Preston Deklerk

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This coat is amazing! I am 6'2 200 and got the Large. This size was a perfect fit. I spent 4 hours in a heavy wet snow and it just bounced off the coat. And the breast goggles pocket fits 3 beers perfectly. Which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Slightly bigger, But nevertheless 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely high-quality jacket, the inside looks just as good as the outside. I bought a Medium and I usually like my gear baggy, but for some reason it came out a little bigger than expected. I'm 5'6 32w size. Could just be that I'm really short, but other than that, I would hands down buy another one or recommend it to anyone looking for a nice Burton jacket.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Mee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, well-made, high-quality jacket!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, high quality jacket. My son loves it, and wears it all the time. And he typically hates wearing a coat! Also, even though it’s technically a “snowboard” jacket, it isn’t sloppy looking and he’s worn it over a sweater and khaki pants and still looked decent. My son is 5,8, about 125 pounds (on the thin side with long arms) and the small fit him beautifully with a little room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Oldmoneybooks

customer_reviews.title: Great jacket that can be worn on the slopes or everyday wear.
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'11 195lbs with broader chest and shoulders. I tried both the medium and large sizes. The medium fits but a bit snug in the underarms especially with a midlayer. If I didn't plan on layering and just wore for everyday use the medium fits nicely. I ended up going with the large which still fits well but gave more room for layering. The large plus a fleece makes for the perfect fit!
customer_reviews.author: Donel A

customer_reviews.title: Great for warmer ski slopes
customer_reviews.text: Negatives: can't remove hood, and uhhhh... That's it. Positives: TONS OF POCKETS for skiers! They're all fairly well protected yet easy to access. Water/snow resistance seems good thus far (after four days on the slopes) Pit zips are a MAJOR plus for SoCal skiers. Reasonably warm - thus isn't an Arctic or high Alpine jacket by itself, but it's great at SoCal and NorCal slopes. If you're going somewhere colder, you'll want to layer. Not bulky, I've got good freedom of movement in this thing. But hey, I'm wearing this with a long-sleeved T at Snow Summit, and it's perfect. Plus, it was at a seriously good price.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: "Softer" than usual Burton gear
customer_reviews.text: OK, I'm an old time snowboarder (1980's - ) and Burton has always been a name associated with top quality. We purchased this shell for one of our teenagers and I was extremely surprised to find the material to be a much thinner, softer, and cheaper quality than what I've always been used to from Burton. It honestly seems like it could tear from a serious fall, or that it wouldn't serve as an impenetrable shield from the deep winter winds on the chairlifts. If you board/ski in milder climates and are not hardcore (willing to take hard crashes), this is for you. If you're in New England or the Rockies, I'd suggest a different purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Noel

customer_reviews.title: Overall satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm satisfied. Only thing is it's a bit too wide at waist. It's a straight fit so it feels large at waist. I could have gone one size down. But everybody's different I suppose. Product quality is great. Tested in 25-30°F temperature last week, no issue at all. 5 stars because for the price it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent-D

customer_reviews.title: Great presents
customer_reviews.text: It was time to replace an old coat that wasn’t holding the warmth in any more. This coat was a gift and he loves it more then any of his coats. There are lots of pockets. (Note: the bottom pocket flaps are fake... pockets are on the side of that same pockets) Not a loud coat (Fabrics is not crinkly) The high front zip-up stops the wind from going down your neck.

customer_reviews.title: Burton holds true

As the season comes to an end I can say this is one of the best jackets I have owned. I never felt wet after a long day riding and do not remember a time I actually felt cold when wearing it. Even during the periodic blizzards while riding, I never wore more than one layer under the jacket. I would highly recommend.

product_meta.title: Burton Covert Snowboard Jacket Mens
product_meta.description: Accelerate your comfort with the premium feel and performance of the insulated Burton Covert Jacket. Its THERMOLITE Insulation is 40% recycled, and select colorways are blue sign approved to lighten the impact on both people and the planet. Our exclusive thermo-regulating Living Lining offers the ultimate in adaptable warmth and consistent comfort. A proverbial pot of gold, the Covert Jacket's full list of features includes a helmet-friendly Contour hood, a removable waist gaiter, and pockets for just about everything. Shell:100% Nylon, Lining:100% Nylon, Insulation:55% Polyester, 45% Recycled Polyester.
feature_bullets: DRYRIDE two-layer fabric [10,000MM, 10,000G] is waterproof and breathable for outstanding weather protection
Living Lining mapped with THERMOLITE and blocked embossed taffeta regulates body temperature, adapting to ups and downs of your activity
Critically taped seams keep the elements out; Helmet-compatible fulltime Contour hood features rear cinching
Removable ergonomic water-resistant magic stitch waist gaiter with jacket-to-pant interface seals out snow; Media and goggle pocket, interior mesh dump pocket for storage
Standard jacket features include: Pit Zips, media port, glove loops, and pocket clip
